overview:
Matt Terenzio develops news websites.

In 2011, he launched Localeaks, a service for citizens to provide anonymous news tips to local and state news organizations. The service was developed as part of the CUNY Graduate School’s Entrepreneurial Journalism program.

He has built news sites and services for companies like New York Newsday and was a member of the Tribune Company Corporate Product Development Committee.

Matt hold a Master’s degree in Internet Engineering and has done some data modeling and J2EE application development for The Berkman Center for Internet and Society at Harvard Law School pertaining to the Public Radio Exchange. His work on Instant Messaging and RSS was featured in the popular O’Reilly Media book PHP Hacks. He has a Bachelor of Arts degree with a major in English Literature, concentrating on Renaissance poetry, and a minor in Mass Communications.
